items.title: Ley signals Liberals won't back PM's 'unsalvageable' hate crime, gun control reforms
items.description: A new offence in the government's bill would outlaw the promotion of hatred based on race, colour, ethnicity or nationality, but some Liberal MPs are flagging concerns it will restrict freedom of speech.

items.title: Politicising Bondi backfires for Liberals who got what they asked for
items.description: Federal Liberals are discovering the price of having been so brazen in their politicisation of the Bondi terror attack and many appear to have buyers' remorse.

items.title: Adelaide Festival Corporation apologises to author Randa Abdel-Fattah
items.description: The Adelaide Festival Corporation, which oversees Adelaide Writers' Week, has apologised to Palestinian Australian author Randa Abdel-Fattah and says she will be invited to speak at its next event in 2027.

items.title: 'Heartbroken' farm workers chase $260,000 in unpaid wages
items.description: According to court documents, at least 20 workers are owed money for the work they did in late 2023 on Corrigan's Farm in south-east Melbourne, which experts say is part of a bigger problem that sees tens of millions in missing cash disappear into the black economy.

items.title: European nations send troops to Greenland as White House talks fail
items.description: The United States and Denmark continue to disagree over the future of Greenland after a meeting at the White House amid ongoing threats from President Donald Trump threatening to seize the semi-autonomous Danish territory for national security reasons.

items.title: Risking her life, a young Iranian breaks through the blackout with a message for Trump
items.description: From inside Iran, a defiant voice bravely breaks through the internet blackout to detail the horrors she has witnessed and to tell the president of the United States "the people are waiting for America to intervene".

items.title: US to suspend immigrant visa processing for 75 countries
items.description: The US State Department will suspend processing of immigrant visas for people from 75 countries, including Fiji, Cambodia, Thailand, Somalia and Brazil, from January 21.

items.title: Prominent neo-Nazi figure denied bail again over alleged threat to MP
items.description: High-ranking neo-Nazi Joel Davis has told a Sydney court the Nationalist Socialist Network (NSN) "no longer exists" as he was again denied bail for allegedly threatening a federal MP.

items.title: US announces second phase of Gaza ceasefire plan
items.description: With little fanfare, the White House has announced "phase two" of the Gaza ceasefire has begun — at least, in terms of how it views the situation with the war-ravaged territory.

items.title: Live: Deal gives workers a role in AI revolution, say ACTU, Microsoft
items.description: Australia's peak union body moves to shore up tech, creative and media jobs, while the ASX is flat after another Wall Street slide. Follow the day's events and insights as they happen with our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

items.title: Complaints roll in as record crowds watch qualifiers in AO 'Opening Week'
items.description: The Australian Open has smashed attendance records in what is being marketed as "Opening Week", featuring fan events and qualifying matches, but the main draw does not start until Sunday.

items.title: Live: Kokkinakis withdraws from Australian Open as draw is conducted
items.description: The Australian Open is almost here — but first we have the draw, which will determine the mouth-watering first round match-ups and what the possible finals could look like. Follow live.

items.title: How the new passport rules for UK dual citizens will work
items.description: Your guide to new UK and Ireland passport rules for dual citizens and general entry changes beginning in February.

items.title: Why apartments with floor-to-ceiling windows are a 'trade-off' in Australia
items.description: Large glazed windows are a popular design flaw in Australian apartments, according to an expert.

items.title: Police say 11 explosive devices found on Canberra streets
items.description: Eleven explosive devices have been found next to footpaths in the city's north-west in the past two days, ACT police say.

items.title: 'No joke, London Bridge has fallen down': Trapped on a crumbling Apostle
items.description: Kelli Bryers wasn't sure if anyone had seen the London Bridge rock formation collapse just seconds after she and her cousin, David Darrington, had crossed it.

items.title: Fire leaves Harcourt family searching for home in tight rental market
items.description: Four weeks after unpacking their last box, a Harcourt family fled fire with only their passports and clothes — and now face a difficult search for a new rental.

items.title: Two French men to plead guilty over alleged $10m theft in Canberra
items.description: Lawyers say the value of the allegedly stolen luxury goods, including a $5 million Richard Mille watch, is disputed as the case returns to court.

items.title: Can writers' festivals survive a 'censorship' crisis?
items.description: The shock cancellation of Adelaide Writers' Week has left many concerned about the future of writers' festivals in an increasingly polarised political world.

items.title: Sick astronaut starts journey to Earth from International Space Station
items.description: The Crew Dragon capsule has undocked from the International Space Station carrying four astronauts, one of whom has a "serious medical condition", and is on its way back to Earth.

items.title: Rental market growth stalls as tenants hit limit of what they can pay
items.description: Australia's rental market is "starting to rebalance" with prices flat in some capital cities but affordability remains a concern, according to Domain, which says an annual salary of $100,000 is needed to live comfortably.

items.title: Antonio Arena has put the football world on notice, but will he play for the Socceroos?
items.description: In Italy, he has earned the nickname Il Baby Bomber because of his size, strength and impact on the game. But where do his international allegiances lie?

items.title: Australian champ vows to finish Dakar with broken collarbone, sternum
items.description: Daniel Sanders says he has broken his collarbone and sternum in a crash on stage 10 of the Dakar Rally, but vows to finish the last three stages.

items.title: Tongans remember massive volcanic eruption, four years on
items.description: Three people lost their lives in the disaster, and major damage was caused to infrastructure and crops in the surrounding islands.

items.title: Families warn of risks after hiring au pairs through social media
items.description: Families who turned to social media to find an au pair say the lack of safeguards left them vulnerable to serious problems.
